sentences.english: Chinese Hamsters were introduced into the UK pet market in the 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 二十世紀六十年代被引進到英國寵物市場。

sentences.english: Vaudeville was very popular in the United States during the early nineteen hundreds.
sentences.chinese: 在二十世紀初期，歌舞雜耍在美國城鄉深受歡迎。

sentences.english: He led a peace movement in the late 1930’s.
sentences.chinese: 他在二十世紀三十年代末的時候領導了一個和平運動。

sentences.english: Great changes took place in the l970s .
sentences.chinese: 在二十世紀七十年代發生了很大的變化。

sentences.english: Into the 19th century those caverns and tunnels were mined for building stone.
sentences.chinese: 直到二十世紀，這些大礦洞和隧道還在開採建築石料。

sentences.english: The crested ibis was declared extinct in Japan in the 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 二十世紀70年代在日本，朱䴉已被宣佈瀕絕。

sentences.english: The second American feminist movement began in the 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 第二次美國婦女運動始於二十世紀六十年代中期。

sentences.english: Mr. Meng Wentong is an unmatched master of Sinology in 20th Century China.
sentences.chinese: 蒙文通先生是中國二十世紀卓爾不羣的國學大師。

sentences.english: The early twentieth century marked an era of beginnings and endings.
sentences.chinese: 二十世紀初標誌着一個時代的開始與終結。

sentences.english: There are many people who say Thomas Edison single-handedly invented the twentieth century.
sentences.chinese: 有許多人認爲是愛迪生一手創造了二十世紀。

sentences.english: He is an influential figure in early 20th-century.
sentences.chinese: 他是二十世紀初具有影響的人物。

sentences.english: Don't blame Honeywell—blame the computing world of the 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 別怪霍尼韋爾，更別怪二十世紀六十年代的計算機界。

sentences.english: The pochards were believed to be extinct in the late 1990s.
sentences.chinese: 紅頭潛鴨在二十世紀九十年代末被認爲已滅絕。

sentences.english: Futurism , an early twentieth-century movement in art, rejected all traditions and at.
sentences.chinese: 未來主義，二十世紀早期的一個藝術思潮。

sentences.english: It was imported from Latin America to South East Asia in the 1980s.
sentences.chinese: 它是二十世紀八十年代從拉丁美洲進口到東南亞的。

sentences.english: Mid-century modern style is characterized by simplicity and natural shapes.
sentences.chinese: 二十世紀中葉現代風格的起居室設計，簡約自然。

definition: to reform and open to the outside world/refers to Deng Xiaoping's policies from around 1980
specific topic (addressed by a book, lecture, TV program etc)/article, report or program etc on a specific topic
to rise/to spring up/to burgeon/to be aroused/to come into vogue
Chang Dai-chien or Zhang Daqian (1899-1983), one of the greatest Chinese artists of the 20th century
